data.title: winreg update
data.body:
- [x] Windows 7  @joaomoreno 
- [x] Windows 8.1 @joaomoreno 
- [x] Windows 10 @joaomoreno

We updated winreg from 0.12 to 1.2.0. Since this module is critical to produce a machine identifier on Windows, we have to make sure we still receive the identifier on all Windows OS we support. Set a breakpoint in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/telemetry/node/nodeAppInsightsTelemetryAppender.ts#L91 and https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/telemetry/node/nodeAppInsightsTelemetryAppender.ts#L104 and verify the result is the same for running VS Code stable.

Note: since we seem to store the value in local storage, it is best to try the testing on a fresh VM.

data.title: Question: It this possible to access tsserver from plugins
data.body:
Hello, this is mostly a question. I want to add an ability to access type information to `tslint` (see https://github.com/palantir/tslint/issues/1154) and the most efficient way to achieve this is to access existing tsserver instance if it's available. I think that this access can be helpful for some other plugins too.

I know that vscode starts it's own tsserver instance in electron's fork, so maybe it's possible to access it somehow to make requests.

I can't find anything about this in the docs. Please point me to the corresponding page if it exists.

Thanks!

data.title: Markdown preview does not auto-update without an open editor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: OSX 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a markdown file and split the window into 1-editor pane and 1-view pane.
2. Notice that edits made in the editor automatically update the view pane.
3. Open the file in vim and make edits.
4. Notice that the edits made in vim automatically update the view pane.
5. Close the editor pane.
6. Notice that vim changes no longer update the view pane.

data.title: Wrong Folder Path for Open after OSX Rename in picker

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: OSX 10.11

**Steps to Reproduce**
1. `File -> Open`
2. Browse to project folder (`example_proj`).
3. Right click in OSX file selector to rename project folder
   ![screen shot 2016-04-22 at 10 54 10 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/212305/14759599/3156497a-08dd-11e6-9663-9d9e98b4d928.png)
4. Rename project folder (`new_example_proj`)
5. Project folder stays selected but now has new name.
6. Click Open

**Expected**
Project opens with renamed folder

**Actual**
![screen shot 2016-04-22 at 10 54 26 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/212305/14759607/5fc95612-08dd-11e6-8fe8-e15af1d5c1e2.png)

Folder does not open.

Deselecting and reselecting the renamed project folder fixes the problem.

data.title: Unable to build on raspberry pi3
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.1
- OS Version: Linux raspbian 4.1.19-v7+ #858 SMP Tue Mar 15 15:56:00 GMT 2016 armv7l GNU/Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. followed Scott Hanselman's steps: http://www.hanselman.com/blog/BuildingVisualStudioCodeOnARaspberryPi3.aspx
   I couldn't get the newer node / npm the way he suggested, so I used these steps:

curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup | sudo bash -
sudo apt-get install -y nodejs
1. then I ran 
   :~/Downloads/vscode $ ./scripts/npm.sh install --arch=armhf --no-optional

> Code@1.0.1 preinstall /home/sorakiu/Downloads/vscode
> node build/npm/preinstall.js

npm WARN optional dep failed, continuing windows-mutex@0.2.0
npm ERR! Linux 4.1.19-v7+
npm ERR! argv "/usr/bin/nodejs" "/usr/bin/npm" "install" "--arch=armhf" "--no-optional"
npm ERR! node v4.4.3
npm ERR! npm  v2.15.1
npm ERR! code EBADPLATFORM

npm ERR! notsup Unsupported
npm ERR! notsup Not compatible with your operating system or architecture: fsevents@0.3.8
npm ERR! notsup Valid OS:    darwin
npm ERR! notsup Valid Arch:  any
npm ERR! notsup Actual OS:   linux
npm ERR! notsup Actual Arch: arm

npm ERR! Please include the following file with any support request:
npm ERR!     /home/sorakiu/Downloads/vscode/npm-debug.log

I've seen this error listed several times on the net, but I don't really see a solution.

[npm-debug.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/232794/npm-debug.txt)

data.title: Command line/wait support for git is too verbose
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Set up VSCode as your Git editor (as per the instructions in the VSCode v1.0.0 Updates).
2. From the command line, launch the Git editor. You can call 'git config --global -e' for instance.

**Result:**
VSCode is launched. I close it and I find my console like this:

```
C:\>git config --global -e

[12844:33788:0422/183248:VERBOSE1:crash_service_main.cc(68)] Session start. cmdline is [--reporter-url=https://ticinocrashreporter.azurewebsites.net/crash --application-name=VSCode --v=1]
[12844:33788:0422/183248:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(142)] window handle is 0250105A
[12844:33788:0422/183248:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(290)] pipe name is \\.\pipe\VSCode Crash Service
dumps at C:\Users\alshaker\AppData\Local\Temp\VSCode Crashes
[12844:33788:0422/183248:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(294)] checkpoint is C:\Users\alshaker\AppData\Local\Temp\VSCode Crashes\crash_checkpoint.txt
server is https://ticinocrashreporter.azurewebsites.net/crash
maximum 128 reports/day
reporter is electron-crash-service
[12844:33788:0422/183248:VERBOSE1:crash_service_main.cc(84)] Ready to process crash requests
[12844:51472:0422/183248:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(323)] client start. pid = 41860
[12844:51472:0422/183248:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(323)] client start. pid = 51724
[50628:50588:0422/183248:VERBOSE1:crash_service_main.cc(68)] Session start. cmdline is [--reporter-url=https://ticinocrashreporter.azurewebsites.net/crash --application-name=VSCode --v=1]
[50628:50588:0422/183248:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(142)] window handle is 0289045E
[50628:50588:0422/183248:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(290)] pipe name is \\.\pipe\VSCode Crash Service
dumps at C:\Users\alshaker\AppData\Local\Temp\VSCode Crashes
[50628:50588:0422/183248:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(294)] checkpoint is C:\Users\alshaker\AppData\Local\Temp\VSCode Crashes\crash_checkpoint.txt
server is https://ticinocrashreporter.azurewebsites.net/crash
maximum 128 reports/day
reporter is electron-crash-service
[50628:50588:0422/183248:ERROR:crash_service.cc(301)] could not start dumper
[12844:23300:0422/183253:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(331)] client end. pid = 41860
[12844:23300:0422/183253:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(331)] client end. pid = 51724

C:\>[12844:23300:0422/183254:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(352)] zero clients. exiting
[12844:33788:0422/183254:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(490)] session ending..
[12844:33788:0422/183254:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(495)] clients connected :2
clients terminated :2
dumps serviced :0
dumps reported :0
[12844:33788:0422/183254:VERBOSE1:crash_service_main.cc(89)] Session end. return code is 0
```

You can see it bleeds to the second prompt too.
Is this expected? Is there any way to hide this or make it less verbose?

- OS Version: Fedora 23 x86_64

```

Commit fa6d0f03813dfb9df4589c30121e9fcffa8a8ec8

Shell 0.35.6
Renderer 45.0.2454.85
```

2. Type `#!/usr/bin/env/python\nprint("Hello world!")`
3. Click "File" > "Save as" 
4. Click "Documents" > type  "example2.py" ("example3.py", "example4.py")
5. Click "File" > "Open Recent"
   - "~/Documents" shows in the Open Recent menu, but example2.py does not

data.title: Editor windows goes blank in low memory conditions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0 (1.0.0) (2016-04-13T10:59:46.727Z)
- OS Version: Macintosh 10.10.5 (14F1713)

Steps to Reproduce:

Pre-requisite: Mac is memory starved -- I have FireFox and Safari sessions both running which are consuming GB of memory
1. Open any code file

Results:
Display is completely blank.  You can tell the editor believes stuff is there (it will scroll the window, etc), but you cannot see anything in your editor window.

Closing down the FireFox and Safari sessions consuming the large amounts of memory, and then restarting vscode will cause the code file to display normally again.

data.title: Install extensions without restarting the editor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I searched on the issue tracker and I wasnt able to find an open discussion on this feature improvement. So here it is, the idea would be to remove the Restart Code step that we have to do after the installation of a new extension and which breaks the workflow (for instance if you have unsaved files you need to make a decision on them) and isnt applied on every Code instances (cf. #3268).

I understand that from a technical point of view, it is easier to restart the editor if its code base changed because of a new extension. However it should still be possible to implement some dynamic extension loading with the correct abstractions and some engineering effort. So I would be happy if this issue could host the discussion on the technical challenges involved and the willingness to make dynamic loading happen.

data.title: Insert Tabs Instead of Spaces No Longer Works
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: OSX El Cap 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Code --> Preferences --> User Settings
2. In settings.json, add `"editor.insertSpaces": false` and save
3. Restart VSCode
4. Open a source code document in the editor and position cursor somewhere
5. Hit tab key

Expected behaviour: a tab `\t` character is inserted
Actual behaviour: spaces are inserted (4 in my case)

Note: previously worked. Seems to have stopped working with 1.0.0 release.

data.title: Setup sync job for wiki
data.body:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode.wiki.git needs to sync back and forth with https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-wiki.git so PRs on vscode-wiki are pulled in to vscide.wiki and vise versa.

See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/5669 and https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/5670

data.title: Debug Console output not printing output at correct interval
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.1-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

I was testing in Powershell but I was able to reproduce for Javascript.
1. Add the below code and debug with the Powershell extension
2. Observe the speed of the output numbers.

With Start-Sleep set at 100ms output prints 6 lines per refresh instead of printing one line every 100ms. Set at 200ms, 3 lines are printed per refresh, etc.

``` powershell
function Write-Item($itemCount) {
    $i = 1

    while ($i -le $itemCount) {
        $str = "Output $i"
        Write-Output $str

        # In the gutter on the left, right click and select "Add Conditional Breakpoint"
        # on the next line. Use the condition: $i -eq 25
        $i = $i + 1

        # Slow down execution a bit so user can test the "Pause debugger" feature.
        Start-Sleep -Milliseconds 100
    }
}

# Do-Work will be underlined in green if you haven't disable script analysis.
# Hover over the function name below to see the PSScriptAnalyzer warning that "Do-Work"
# doesn't use an approved verb.
function Do-Work($workCount) {
    Write-Output "Doing work..."
    Write-Item $workcount
    Write-Host "Done!"
}

Do-Work 50


```

data.title: Previously open working files are not validated when reopening vscode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: latest

Steps to reproduce:

``` bash
mkdir temp
touch a b c
code .
```
- add `a`, `b` and `c` to working files
- close code

``` bash
rm a
code .
```

Notice `a` is still in working files, clicking it results in a file not found error.

---

This happens most for me when I'm switching between branches, and forces me to clear out the working files manually.

3. add git remote of upstream as the original git repository

Tried searching documentation, couldn't find the way.

Kind Regards.

data.title: Decorations not visible on High Contrast theme
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Create a decoration for a range with the following `DecorationRenderOptions`

```
{
    borderRadius: "3px",
    borderWidth: "1px",
    borderStyle: "solid",
    backgroundColor: "rgba(255,0,0,0.3)",
    borderColor: "rgba(255,100,100,0.15)"
}
```

2.Switch to the `High Contrast` theme.

The decorations are no longer visible. Not sure if this is by design.
